page.title: 13ECOLOGY 4
page.content: contd from page 12 There are lesser numbers of bartailed godwits, knot and dunlin, and plovers, greenshanks and ruffs are all occasional visitors. For those interested in bird life , Udale Bay is most rewarding and many people visit here regularly, both independantly and with field study groups. Local sportsmen also spend some of their leisure time here as the Black Isle Wildfowlers Association have an agreement for acces to shoot wild geese during the shooting season. Accurate records of shooting are kept and a strict watch is observed to see that spotsmen abide by the rules.
